definition: to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: What has been your charge for repeating this very plausible story?
sentences.chinese: 你複述這個娓娓動聽的故事，得到了多少酬勞？

sentences.english: You are a paid employee and but one member of a busy team.
sentences.chinese: 你是一個有酬勞的僱員，繁忙族中的一員。

sentences.english: A doctor advised her to seek remunerative employment.
sentences.chinese: 一個醫生建議她去找有酬勞的工作。

sentences.english: I'll give you a handsome tip.
sentences.chinese: 我會給你一筆豐厚的酬勞的。

sentences.english: Requital will be paid to anyone who brings back the documents he lost.
sentences.chinese: 凡能將他丟失的文件尋回者可得酬勞。

sentences.english: When evening came the butcher gave him a nice leg of mutton for his services.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚時分，肉販送他一隻很好的羊腿作爲酬勞。

sentences.english: And the only reward I ask is I might be allowed to rape and kill my sister.
sentences.chinese: 而我唯一所要的酬勞是讓我姦殺我老姐。

sentences.english: Yet adults get paid for their work.
sentences.chinese: 不過成年人會因他們的工作而得到酬勞。

sentences.english: Should pastors or elders be paid, or serve as a volunteer?
sentences.chinese: 牧師或長老需要付給酬勞，還是志願的事奉呢？

sentences.english: Can't be better. I get a better-paid job last week.
sentences.chinese: 不能再好了，我上週得到了一份高酬勞的工作。

sentences.english: An attendant, for a consideration, brought him the morning papers.
sentences.chinese: 一個侍役想得些酬勞，送來了早晨的報紙。

sentences.english: Red starts pulling out contraband, giving them their commissions.
sentences.chinese: 瑞德開始取出偷帶的違禁品，並付給他們相應的酬勞。

sentences.english: Refreshments are given as a reward for reading.
sentences.chinese: 給他們點心喫，作爲他們讀書的酬勞。

sentences.english: When evening came the baker gave him a large tom-cat for his services.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚來臨，麪包師送他一隻公貓作爲酬勞。

definition: to make a profit/to earn a packet
to quote a price/seller's first offer
